channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Gangs use sexual violence to control communities in Haiti
item.description: Jacqueline Charles of the Miami Herald reports on how gangs in Haiti are using sexual violence as a tool of terror amid the country's deepening political and humanitarian crisis.
item.content:encoded: Jacqueline Charles of the Miami Herald reports on how gangs in Haiti are using sexual violence as a tool of terror amid the country's deepening political and humanitarian crisis.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Is being in Congress still a good gig?
item.description: Inside Congress, lawmakers describe an institution under strain from polarization and constant pressure.
item.content:encoded: Inside Congress, lawmakers describe an institution under strain from polarization and constant pressure.
item.dc:creator: Barbara Sprunt

item.title: How NPR's 'Newscast' turns breaking news into trusted headlines
item.description: Korva Coleman describes what it takes to get the news right when millions hear it first through NPR newscasts.
item.content:encoded: Korva Coleman describes what it takes to get the news right when millions hear it first through NPR newscasts.
item.dc:creator: Linah Mohammad

item.title: How improv is helping federal workers cope with job cuts
item.description: A Washington D.C. improv group is offering laid-off federal workers a way to cope with uncertainty through play and building skills.
item.content:encoded: A Washington D.C. improv group is offering laid-off federal workers a way to cope with uncertainty through play and building skills.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: 'It's behind you!' How Britain goes wild for pantomimes during the holidays
item.description: Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.
item.content:encoded:
Pantomimes are plays based on a well-known story — often a fairy tale — which are given a bawdy twist. The audience is expected to join in throughout, shouting as loudly as they can.

(Image credit: Ella Carmen Dale)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: Rediscovering delight in the kitchen when cooking feels like a burden
item.description: Tamar Adler, chef and author of 'Feast On Your Life', writes about food as a daily practice of care rather than obligation.
item.content:encoded: Tamar Adler, chef and author of 'Feast On Your Life', writes about food as a daily practice of care rather than obligation.
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: ICE is deporting some immigrants so quickly, their attorneys are left scrambling
item.description: Immigrants who are detained by ICE often get deported out of state so quickly that their attorneys don't have time to file petitions to keep them in the state where they were arrested.
item.content:encoded: Immigrants who are detained by ICE often get deported out of state so quickly that their attorneys don't have time to file petitions to keep them in the state where they were arrested.
item.dc:creator: Beenish Ahmed

item.title: The latest on the nuclear sub deal between the U.S. and South Korea
item.description: The U.S. will shift some of the burden of defense to its allies, and it will equip them for it. One ally's equipment: nuclear submarines for South Korea.
item.content:encoded: The U.S. will shift some of the burden of defense to its allies, and it will equip them for it. One ally's equipment: nuclear submarines for South Korea.
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Ranchers test virtual fence technology's ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bears
item.description: Technology enabling virtual fences for pets is now being adapted for livestock. Ranchers near Yellowstone National Park are testing its ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bear attacks.
item.content:encoded: Technology enabling virtual fences for pets is now being adapted for livestock. Ranchers near Yellowstone National Park are testing its ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bear attacks.
item.dc:creator: Hanna Merzbach

item.title: NPR's 'Code Switch': Joy as Resistance
item.description: Leah Donnella of NPR's Code Switch has spent some time unpacking what it would mean for joy to be used as a means of resistance.
item.content:encoded: Leah Donnella of NPR's Code Switch has spent some time unpacking what it would mean for joy to be used as a means of resistance.
item.dc:creator: Leah Donnella
